definition: surname Fu/abbr. for Fujian province 福建省[Fu2 jian4 sheng3]
pool/pond/(of metals etc) luster/favor or beneficence/damp/moist
Fukuzawa Yukichi (1835-1901), prominent Japanese Westernizer, liberal educator and founder of Keio University

sentences.chinese: 偶爾辰，矇昧也是一種福澤。

sentences.english: Fukuzawayukichi holds that the final aim of the development of civilization is, the independence of Japanese nation.
sentences.chinese: 福澤諭吉認爲文明發展的最終目的是日本的國家獨立。

sentences.english: If the rain god lowered Ganlin, Fuze creatures convey the voiceless.
sentences.chinese: 雨如神仙降下的甘霖，傳遞着福澤衆生的清音。

sentences.english: It will look at the East-West cultural ideologies from Youwei-kang and Yukichi-Fukuzawa's perspectives in the first section.
sentences.chinese: 第一部分主要探討康有爲與福澤諭吉的東西文化觀。

sentences.english: Add a share, minus one points and blessings.
sentences.chinese: 增一分享受，減一分福澤。

sentences.english: The fifth chapter actually is a reflection, and the conclusion as well.
sentences.chinese: 第五章是福澤瑜吉教育思想反思，亦是研究的結論。

definition: work or plans left as a legacy/the views of the departed/posthumous orders or teachings
of noble character and unquestionable integrity (idiom)
passed on from generation to generation (idiom); to hand down
mulberry farming/to grow mulberry for sericulture
to bend to a task and spare no effort (idiom); striving to the utmost
to exhaust one's thoughts and ingenuity (idiom); to think sth through thoroughly/to rack one's brains/to leave no stone unturned
